key_points: Tugboat crew on Brittany Lynn faced Hurricane Ida at Port Fourchon.
Relief captain Shannon Dryden and his team were unable to leave before the hurricane struck.
Ida hit as a Category 4 hurricane with 150-mph winds and extensive storm surge.
The crew experienced severe conditions, including visibility issues and destructive winds.
A significant moment of fear occurred when their barge was hit by loose boats, breaking it free.
The crew managed to secure the barge again after the eye of the storm passed.
They endured additional challenges as the back side of the hurricane hit.
Approximately 40 boats with around 300 people were at Port Fourchon during the landfall.
No major injuries were reported by Chett Chiasson, executive director of the Greater Lafourche Port Commission.
Shannon Dryden expressed he would never choose to ride out a storm on a boat again.
spokespersons: Chett Chiasson (Executive Director, Greater Lafourche Port Commission)
